sentence: They is watching a movie now.
I have a few ideas for the project.
rational: 'a few'는 긍정 의미로 복수 명사와 함께 사용됩니다.

sentence: My favorite color are blue.
He has already eaten lunch.
Do he know how to cook?
That sounds like a good idea.
She were excited about the trip.
The children are playing in the park.
He don’t like to eat vegetables.
I was tired because I hadn’t slept well.
The book and the pen is on the table.
Has he ever been to Australia?
rational: 현재완료 시제에서 'Has he ever been' 구문이 올바르게 사용되었습니다.

sentence: He don’t knows what to do.
This kind of problem is common.
rational: 'This kind of + 단수명사' 구조에서 단수 동사 'is'가 잘 사용되었습니다.

sentence: There is some books on the desk.
I didn’t forget to lock the door.
She is used to work late at night.
rational: 'be used to' 뒤에는 동명사 'working'이 와야 합니다.

sentence: It takes an hour to get to school.
rational: 'It takes + 시간 + to부정사' 구문이 정확하게 사용되었습니다.

sentence: They enjoys spending time together.
Is she coming to the party tonight?
He wants that I help him.
rational: 'wants me to help him' 형태가 올바른 표현입니다.

sentence: How many money do you have?
He usually drives to work.
The team are playing well today.
Let’s not argue about this.
rational: 제안형 부정문에서 'let’s not' 구문이 올바르게 사용되었습니다.

sentence: He was sleep when I called.
rational: 'sleep'은 상태 동사로 쓰일 수 없고, 'asleep'이 맞는 표현입니다.

sentence: Few students passed the exam.
rational: 'few'는 부정적 의미로 복수 명사 'students'와 잘 어울립니다.

sentence: He is taller than I.
rational: 비교급 표현과 주격 'I'의 조합이 문법적으로 정확합니다.

sentence: This is the man which helped me.
rational: 사람을 지칭할 때는 관계대명사 'who'를 사용해야 합니다.

sentence: She told to me a secret.
rational: 'tell'은 전치사 없이 직접 목적어를 받아야 하므로 'told me'가 맞습니다.

sentence: We have a lot of homeworks to do.
Neither answer is correct.
There isn’t any people here.
I wish I had more time.
She’s enough old to travel alone.
rational: 'enough'는 형용사 뒤에 와야 하므로 'old enough'가 맞습니다.

sentence: The students was very noisy.
She studied hard and passed the exam.
rational: 두 개의 과거 시제가 자연스럽게 연결되어 있습니다.

sentence: Does she can play the violin?
rational: 'Does'와 'can'을 함께 쓸 수 없으며, 'Can she play' 또는 'Does she play'로 써야 합니다.

sentence: The baby is crying loudly.
That kind of shoes are expensive.
We didn’t went anywhere last weekend.
He is responsible for the mistake.
Everybody have their own room.
You need to take a break.
The number of students have increased.
She don’t has a laptop.
My uncle lives in Canada.
rational: 3인칭 단수 주어와 동사 'lives'의 현재시제가 잘 맞습니다.

sentence: There are a pen on the desk.
Has she finished her homework yet?
I can playing the piano.
We often go hiking on weekends.
He is boring during the meeting.
rational: 'boring'은 사람의 성격을 나타낼 때 쓰이므로, 'bored'가 맞습니다.

sentence: Both of them are good at math.
rational: 'both of'는 복수 취급이므로 복수 동사 'are'가 올바르게 사용되었습니다.

sentence: Does she likes chocolate?
rational: 'Does'와 함께 쓸 때는 동사 원형 'like'를 사용해야 합니다.

sentence: All the furniture was moved.
The sun rise in the east.
I met a friend who lives in Paris.
He speaks English good.
rational: 동사를 수식할 때는 형용사 'good'이 아닌 부사 'well'을 써야 합니다.

sentence: Is there any cheese left?
It don’t matter to me.
Each of the players has a locker.
They has three kids.
He had gone before we arrived.
rational: 과거완료 시제와 과거 시제가 자연스럽게 연결되었습니다.

sentence: Whose is this bag?
She didn’t came to the meeting.
The weather is getting colder.
rational: 'get + 형용사' 형태로 변화 상태를 잘 나타내고 있습니다.

sentence: How long you have been living here?
rational: 의문문 어순이 틀렸으며, 'have you been living'이 맞습니다.

sentence: He is afraid of flying.
rational: 'be afraid of' 뒤에 동명사 'flying'이 자연스럽게 쓰였습니다.

sentence: The water boil at 100 degrees Celsius.
That sounds interesting.
My parents lives in Seoul.
rational: 복수 주어 'parents'에는 동사 원형 'live'를 써야 합니다.

sentence: She goes to work by subway.
Do your brother live with you?
The painting was created by a famous artist.
rational: 수동태 과거 시제 표현이 문법적으로 정확합니다.

sentence: Are she coming to the party?
rational: 3인칭 단수 주어에는 'Is'를 사용해야 하므로 'Is she'가 맞습니다.

sentence: He doesn’t like to swim.
rational: 부정형 조동사 'doesn’t'와 동사 원형 'like'의 조합이 맞습니다.

sentence: All of the milk are gone.
She made me cry.
They was waiting for the bus.
This is the most delicious cake I’ve ever had.
He enjoy watching movies.
